directions:
Mix all of the ingredients in a zip-top bag and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours or in the refrigerator overnight.

Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove the meat from the marinade. Grill for 3 minutes per side.

Remove from the grill, and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice the beef against grain.

Serve with tortillas, onions, cabbage and limes.

html.directions:
Mix all of the ingredients in a zip-top bag and marinate at room temperature for 2 hours or in the refrigerator overnight.

Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove the meat from the marinade. Grill for 3 minutes per side.

Remove from the grill, and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice the beef against grain.

Serve with tortillas, onions, cabbage and limes.
html.ingredients:
• 2 lbs Aussie grass-fed flat iron steaks
  • 2 cloves cloves garlic minced
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/4 cup red wine vinegar
  • juice of 2 limes
  • 1/2 tsp kosher salt
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper
  • 1/2 tsp garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp ground cumin
  • 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
html.notes: When trimming a whole flat iron, cut the beef horizontally. There is a membrane that runs down the center of the cut. Removing this membrane ensures that every bite is taco tender.

name: Grilled Aussie Grass-Fed Flat Iron Steak Tacos
notes: When trimming a whole flat iron, cut the beef horizontally. There is a membrane that runs down the center of the cut. Removing this membrane ensures that every bite is taco tender.
